org.datavec.hadoop.records.writer.mapfile

Class MapFileSequenceRecordWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.datavec.hadoop.records.writer.mapfile.AbstractMapFileWriter<java.util.List<java.util.List<Writable>>>
      • org.datavec.hadoop.records.writer.mapfile.MapFileSequenceRecordWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, Configurable, SequenceRecordWriter

    public class MapFileSequenceRecordWriter
extends AbstractMapFileWriter<java.util.List<java.util.List<Writable>>>
implements SequenceRecordWriter
    MapFileSequenceRecordWriter is used to write sequence values to a Hadoop MapFile, that can then be read by: MapFileSequenceRecordReader
    See Also:
    MapFileSequenceRecordReader

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapFileSequenceRecordWriter

        public MapFileSequenceRecordWriter(java.io.File outputDir)
        Constructor for all default values. Single output MapFile, no text writable conversion, default index interval (1), default naming pattern.
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)

      • MapFileSequenceRecordWriter

        public MapFileSequenceRecordWriter(@NonNull
                                   java.io.File outputDir,
                                   int mapFileSplitSize)
        Constructor for most default values. Specified number of output MapFile s, no text writable conversion, default index interval (1), default naming pattern.
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        mapFileSplitSize - Split size for the map file: if 0, use a single map file for all output. If > 0, multiple map files will be used: each will contain a maximum of mapFileSplitSize examples. This can be used to avoid having a single multi gigabyte map file, which may be undesirable in some cases (transfer across the network, for example).

      • MapFileSequenceRecordWriter

        public MapFileSequenceRecordWriter(@NonNull
                                   java.io.File outputDir,
                                   WritableType convertTextTo)
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        convertTextTo - If null: Make no changes to Text writable objects. If non-null, Text writable instances will be converted to this type. This is useful, when would rather store numerical values even if the original record reader produces strings/text.

      • MapFileSequenceRecordWriter

        public MapFileSequenceRecordWriter(@NonNull
                                   java.io.File outputDir,
                                   int mapFileSplitSize,
                                   WritableType convertTextTo)
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        mapFileSplitSize - Split size for the map file: if 0, use a single map file for all output. If > 0, multiple map files will be used: each will contain a maximum of mapFileSplitSize examples. This can be used to avoid having a single multi gigabyte map file, which may be undesirable in some cases (transfer across the network, for example).
        convertTextTo - If null: Make no changes to Text writable objects. If non-null, Text writable instances will be converted to this type. This is useful, when would rather store numerical values even if the original record reader produces strings/text.

      • MapFileSequenceRecordWriter

        public MapFileSequenceRecordWriter(@NonNull
                                   java.io.File outputDir,
                                   int mapFileSplitSize,
                                   WritableType convertTextTo,
                                   org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration hadoopConfiguration)
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        mapFileSplitSize - Split size for the map file: if 0, use a single map file for all output. If > 0, multiple map files will be used: each will contain a maximum of mapFileSplitSize examples. This can be used to avoid having a single multi gigabyte map file, which may be undesirable in some cases (transfer across the network, for example).
        convertTextTo - If null: Make no changes to Text writable objects. If non-null, Text writable instances will be converted to this type. This is useful, when would rather store numerical values even if the original record reader produces strings/text.
        hadoopConfiguration - Hadoop configuration.

      • MapFileSequenceRecordWriter

        public MapFileSequenceRecordWriter(@NonNull
                                   java.io.File outputDir,
                                   int mapFileSplitSize,
                                   WritableType convertTextTo,
                                   int indexInterval,
                                   org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration hadoopConfiguration)
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        mapFileSplitSize - Split size for the map file: if 0, use a single map file for all output. If > 0, multiple map files will be used: each will contain a maximum of mapFileSplitSize examples. This can be used to avoid having a single multi gigabyte map file, which may be undesirable in some cases (transfer across the network, for example).
        convertTextTo - If null: Make no changes to Text writable objects. If non-null, Text writable instances will be converted to this type. This is useful, when would rather store numerical values even if the original record reader produces strings/text.
        indexInterval - Index interval for the Map file. Defaults to 1, which is suitable for most cases
        hadoopConfiguration - Hadoop configuration.

      • MapFileSequenceRecordWriter

        public MapFileSequenceRecordWriter(@NonNull
                                   java.io.File outputDir,
                                   int mapFileSplitSize,
                                   WritableType convertTextTo,
                                   int indexInterval,
                                   java.lang.String filenamePattern,
                                   org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration hadoopConfiguration)
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        mapFileSplitSize - Split size for the map file: if 0, use a single map file for all output. If > 0, multiple map files will be used: each will contain a maximum of mapFileSplitSize examples. This can be used to avoid having a single multi gigabyte map file, which may be undesirable in some cases (transfer across the network, for example).
        convertTextTo - If null: Make no changes to Text writable objects. If non-null, Text writable instances will be converted to this type. This is useful, when would rather store numerical values even if the original record reader produces strings/text.
        indexInterval - Index interval for the Map file. Defaults to 1, which is suitable for most cases
        filenamePattern - The naming pattern for the map files. Used with String.format(pattern, int)
        hadoopConfiguration - Hadoop configuration.
